{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a young, pregnant woman who presents with a painless, mobile, rubbery mass in her breast. The biopsy shows overgrowth of fibrous and glandular tissue. This is characteristic of a fibroadenoma, which is a benign breast tumor that is common in young women. It is composed of both glandular and stromal tissue. Normal pregnancy-related changes would not typically present as a discrete mass. Fat necrosis usually presents as a firm, irregular mass and is often associated with a history of trauma or surgery. Phyllodes tumor is a rare fibroepithelial neoplasm that can present similarly to a fibroadenoma, but it is usually larger and grows more rapidly.", "answer_choice": "A"}
